Title: Relates to the protection and promotion of the mental health of the residents of New York state
Summary: Requires parity in the mental and physical health treatment of the residents of New York state; provides that both mental and physical health "will be matters of public concern and provision therefor shall be made by the state and by such of its subdivisions".
ActClause: Concurrent Resolution of the Senate and Assembly proposing amendments to sections 3 and 4 of article 17 of the constitution, in relation to the protection and promotion of the mental health of New Yorkers
